results.title: Facts about fish
results.brief_description: A study of the various types of fish including the tropical triggerfish; the ray, sole and plaice; sea sticklebacks, pipefish, sea horses, giant catfish, mirror and golden carp and small sturgeons; freshwater pike and perch.
results.description: A study of the various types of fish including the tropical triggerfish; the ray, sole and plaice; sea sticklebacks, pipefish, sea horses, giant catfish, mirror and golden carp and small sturgeons; freshwater pike and perch.

results.title: Facts about film (1959)
results.creator_credit: Robert Longini and Visual Education Films
results.brief_description: Indicates the proper use of film and projectors, how to maintain and repair film, and what causes film damage. Deals with such matters as threading of film in projector, splicing and the ways in which film may be scratched.

results.title: Facts about fabrics
results.brief_description: Describes yarns, constructions, dyeing operations, and finishing methods used in making textiles, and includes some useful tips for the washing and care of various fabrics.

results.title: Facts about AIDS
results.brief_description: A short introduction to AIDS which attempts to dispel some of the myths surrounding the disease. In simple language the video explores what the HIV virus is, how AIDS develops and how the virus is transmitted. Suitable for use in class discussions with young adolescents.

results.title: Factory safety
results.brief_description: Points out how good factory safety records are achieved by such precautionary measures as rule booklets, safety meetings for foremen, stop switches and guards for machines, goggles and respirators for workers and attention to even minor injuries.

results.title: Factory management: the search for savings
results.brief_description: Explains how to locate and reduce product costs during design, purchasing and manufacturing. It demonstrates how personnel can apply value engineering and analysis principles to cut costs.

results.title: Factory inspector
results.creator_credit: Julien Aunter, Dick Andrews, Jim Davies, Leonard Reeve and Anglo-Scottish Pictures
results.brief_description: Approximately 100 years ago (c1848) the Factory Inspectorate was created in England, and with it came laws and regulations designed to safeguard the factory worker. The duties of a factory inspector include the inspection of safety devices and guards on various machines; checking the aprons and gloves of working men; observing the condition and operation of equipment used in the loading and unloading of ships; interviewing a witness of an industrial accident.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julien Aunter, Dick Andrews, Jim Davies, Leonard Reeve and Anglo-Scottish Pictures

results.title: Facing Up to Aids: sex in the '90s
results.brief_description: This documentary gives an insight into sex in the 90’s as a diverse range of people relate their attitudes and experiences and indicate how issues such as AIDS and safe sex have had an impact on their lives.
